context: Since the <a0_0><b5_0><b9_0>early 1960s<b9_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, <a4_0><b8_0>theoretical<b8_0/><a4_0/> linguists have moved away from the traditional concept of a phoneme, preferring to consider basic units at a more <a1_0><b6_0>abstract<b6_0/><a1_0/> level, as a component of morphemes; these units can be called <a2_0><b7_0>morphophonemes<b7_0/><a2_0/>, and analysis using this approach is called <a3_0>morphophonology<a3_0/>.
